form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Rubio introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to modify the allocation of funding to States for the nutrition education and obesity prevention grant program under the supplemental nutrition assistance program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the SNAP Education Allocation Modernization Act of 2023.

section.header: Nutrition education and obesity prevention grant program
section.text: Section 28(d)(2) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2036a(d)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: Of the funds set aside under paragraph (1), as determined by the Secretary, subject to a reallocation under subparagraph (B)—

subclause.text: 40 percent shall be allocated to State agencies in direct proportion to the amount of funding that the State received for carrying out this section during fiscal year 2019; and

60 percent shall be allocated to State agencies based on the respective share of each State of the number of individuals participating in the supplemental nutrition assistance program during the 12-month period ending the preceding January 31;
30 percent shall be allocated to State agencies in direct proportion to the amount of funding that the State received for carrying out this section during fiscal year 2019; and

70 percent shall be allocated to State agencies based on the respective share of each State of the number of individuals participating in the supplemental nutrition assistance program during the 12-month period ending the preceding January 31;
20 percent shall be allocated to State agencies in direct proportion to the amount of funding that the State received for carrying out this section during fiscal year 2019; and

80 percent shall be allocated to State agencies based on the respective share of each State of the number of individuals participating in the supplemental nutrition assistance program during the 12-month period ending the preceding January 31;
10 percent shall be allocated to State agencies in direct proportion to the amount of funding that the State received for carrying out this section during fiscal year 2019; and

90 percent shall be allocated to State agencies based on the respective share of each State of the number of individuals participating in the supplemental nutrition assistance program during the 12-month period ending the preceding January 31; and

clause.text: for fiscal year 2028 and each fiscal year thereafter, 100 percent shall be allocated to State agencies based on the respective share of each State of the number of individuals participating in the supplemental nutrition assistance program during the 12-month period ending the preceding January 31.

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(ii), by striking 2009 each place it appears and inserting 2019.
